Detailed Description

The header file describes the ADC interface.

Definition in file adc.h.

Function Documentation

int HAL_OpenAdc ( HAL_AdcDescriptor_t *  descriptor)

Opens ADC to make measurements on an ADC channel.

The function must be called before the HAL_ReadAdc() function in order to start working with ADC.

Note that for XMEGA hardware channels from the same group (channels are grouped by 4 channels: ADC_HW_CHANNEL_A0..A3 and ADC_HW_CHANNEL_B0..B3) should have the same resolution, conversion mode, reference voltage and sample rate. For other supported hardware platforms channels from the same group may have different parameters.

Parameters:
[in]descriptor- pointer to an instance of HAL_AdcDescriptor_t type
Returns:
-1 - unsupported parameter or ADC is busy
0 - success
int HAL_ReadAdc ( HAL_AdcDescriptor_t *  descriptor,
HAL_AdcChannelNumber_t  channel 
)

Starts ADC with parameters defined in HAL_OpenAdc()

Parameters:
[in]descriptor- pointer to an instance of HAL_AdcDescriptor_t type that was provided to the HAL_OpenAdc() function
[in]channel- logical channel
Take a look into halAdc.h platform specific file fore more details.
Returns:
-1 - unable to open ADC (unsupported channel number)
0 - success
int HAL_CloseAdc ( HAL_AdcDescriptor_t *  descriptor)

Closes ADC - must be called after work with ADC has finished.

Parameters:
[in]descriptor- pointer to an instance of HAL_AdcDescriptor_t structure
Returns:
-1 - the module was not open
0 - success
